oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mastitis prevention by selection of sires
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Grootenhuis, G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine mastitis
breeding
cattle diseases
controls
Cows
Genetics
Mastitis
selection
disease resistence
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The investigation results mentioned led to the hypothesis: "Higher milk cell counts in the 1st lactation daughter groups indicate a higher susceptibility to mastitis and subsequently a higher mastitis prevalence with increasing age". The validity of this hypothesis has been investigated in the presented study by a simple scheme. Older sires were selected for this purpose in order to establish the (different) predicting cell counts in their 1st lactation daughters - and - to examine quarter samples from respective older age groups for the prevalence of mastitis.
